meanings.definition: Concerned with or limited to a specific individual or group.
meanings.sent1: She had a particularistic approach to teaching, focusing on each student's unique needs.
meanings.sent2: The club had a particularistic membership policy, only allowing in a select few.
meanings.sent3: It was particularistic how the cat only wanted to play with the red ball.
meanings.sent4: His particularistic taste in music made him stand out from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The artist's particularistic style was instantly recognizable.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or emphasizing differences between individuals or groups.
meanings.sent1: The particularistic nature of the twins made it easy to tell them apart.
meanings.sent2: The company had a particularistic hiring process, valuing diversity in skills and backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: It was particularistic how the two flowers in the garden seemed to argue with each other.
meanings.sent4: The particularistic patterns on the butterfly's wings were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: Her particularistic approach to team building brought out the best in each member.
